references.reason: This paper provides a technical report on GPT-4, a large language model that serves as a crucial comparison point for the WEBRL model's performance.

references.paper_title: DigiRL: Training in-the-wild device-control agents with autonomous reinforcement learning
references.reason: DigiRL is a key baseline method compared against WEBRL, highlighting the advancements made by WEBRL in online curriculum reinforcement learning for LLM web agents.

references.paper_title: Stop regressing: Training value functions via classification for scalable deep rl
references.reason: This paper addresses the challenge of training value functions in reinforcement learning, providing relevant insights into the methods used in the WEBRL model.

references.paper_title: ChatGLM: A family of large language models from GLM-130B to GLM-4 all tools
references.reason: The GLM-4 model is one of the open LLMs used in the WEBRL experiments, demonstrating its successful adaptation for web-based tasks through WEBRL.

references.paper_title: Middleware for LLMs: Tools are instrumental for language agents in complex environments
references.reason: This paper discusses the challenges and solutions related to building proficient language agents in complex environments, providing context for the WEBRL framework.
